result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven A Meyers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.   Must participate in a restorative justice program/conference that may include the victim(s). Court orders firearm be confiscated.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven A Meyers

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven A Meyers in court with attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
VIS filed.  C-31 presented to the Court - Defense does not object - Court signs C-31.  Attorney Caffee makes correction to PSI.  Argument by State.  Argument by Attorney Caffee.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

SW - 4 years Probation
Must comply with treatment recommendations of AODA
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold
$1,995.00 restitution
Must participate in a restorative justice program/conference that may include the victim(s)
Court costs including DNA surcharge

Court orders firearm be confiscated.

Voting rights and firearm warning given.  Order for DNA given to the defendant in court - Must report to Barron County Jail on Thursday, April 7, 2016 between 1:00 - 5:00 pm.

State relates agreement.

Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. 
Court orders PSI. Bond continues.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
